name: differentially
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is based on a difference: These laws have been very differentially enforced. Women in developing and developed countries are differentially affected. See
differential
More examplesFewer examplesThey are exploring whether experiences of trauma differentially affect the operation of memory in maltreated children.Why are patterns of health and illness so differentially distributed by race and by class?Poverty may be differentially experienced by members of the family.
